subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
First attested as {{l|zh|局}} in {{lang|zh|《廣東省土話字彙》}} {{defdate|1828}} and as {{l|zh|焗}} in {{lang|zh|《粵語全書》}} {{defdate|1905}} ({{zh-ref|Zhang and Li, 2017}}).

Possible origins include:
# From {{ltc-l|酷|to be cooked}} ({{w|zh:陳伯陶|Chen Botao}}, {{lang|zh|《東莞縣志》}}), based on an entry in ''{{w|Fangyan}}'':
#: {{zh-x|胹、飪、亨{pēng}、爛、糦、酋、'''酷'''，熟 也。|''Er'', ''ren'', ''peng'', ''lan'', ''xi'', ''qiu'', '''''ku''''': to be cooked.|collapsed=y|ref=Fangyan}}
# From {{ltc-l|焅|dry, hot air}} ({{zh-ref|Chan, 1995}}).
# From {{ltc-l|熇|hot; blazing}} ({{zh-ref|Zhan and Qiu, 2003}}).
# From {{bor|yue|en|cook}} ({{zh-ref|Zhang and Li, 2017}}).

subSections.title: Definitions
Compounds
subSections.text: {{zh-der|鹽焗雞|焗油|焗坊|焗暑|焗雨|焗爐|焗嚫|焗汗|焗傷風|焗盅|焗腳}}
